description:
During the construction of the Kurobe Dam, an ancient artifact was discovered, and so the United Nations Kurobe Research Institute was established. Intellectuals from all over the world gathered to study the object, and the children of those researchers attend Mt. Tate International Senior High School, including the institute head's daughter, Yukina Shirahane. In the summer of 2016, a lone samurai once again awakens!

(Source: Pony Canyon USA)

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岡村天斎) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tensai_Okamura)

During his university days at Waseda University, Okamura was a part of Waseda's manga research society and together with other budding animators, produced his first independent anime there. Upon graduating from university, Okamura joined the animation production studio Madhouse as an animator through the recommendation of a friend. Lensman was the first series he worked on as an animator. The first anime movies that he worked on were Kamui no Ken and Bobby ni Kubittake. 

In 1989, he made his debut as an episode director with Yawara! and soon made his full directorial debut in 1995 with Memories. He later left Madhouse and went freelance, working on several projects along the way.

In 1991, he changed his first name from Yutaka to Tensai.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1576069694750326785) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/檜垣亮)

Frequents on [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/)' projects, but is freelance.

Was inspired to become an animator after having seen [Ninku](https://anilist.co/anime/912/).
[Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/hiroakitsutsumi) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiroaki850605)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ayumi_nishihata)

Formerly affiliated with [Nomad](https://anilist.co/studio/70). Currently working as a freelance animator.

Frequents on [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/)' projects, but is freelance.

Was inspired to become an animator after having seen [Ninku](https://anilist.co/anime/912/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%8B%A5%E6%9E%97%E5%92%8C%E5%BC%98)

**Kazuhiro Wakabayashi** is a Japanese sound director who was formerly affiliated with Techno Sound and Omnibus Promotion. After going freelance, he established his own sound production studio on May 7, 2004 called Fonishia. In 2013, he went freelance once again after his sound production studio disbanded.

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/glayalg) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/happyswing_official/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/glay_official) | [Website](https://www.glay.co.jp/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/GLAY) __GLAY__ is a rock/pop band formed by guitarist Takuro and vocalist Teru during high school in 1988. GLAY primarily composes songs in the rock and pop genres, but they have also composed songs using elements of different styles such as reggae and gospel. They have sold an estimated amount of 28 million records of forty-three singles and 23 million copies of fourteen albums as of 2008. Members: - Takuro, real name [Takuro Kubo](https://anilist.co/staff/151571/Takurou-Kubo) - guitar (leader and primary songwriter) - Teru, real name [Teruhiko Kobashi](https://anilist.co/staff/150357/Teruhiko-Kobashi) - vocals - Jiro, real name Yoshihito Wayama - bass - Hisashi, real name [Hisashi Tonomura](https://anilist.co/staff/151942/Hisashi-Tonomura) - guitar

Date of Birth: March 30, 1996 Birthplace: Okinawa City, Okinawa Prefecture, Japan Website | Twitter | Instagram Introduction Touyama Michiko (當山美智子), also known by her stage name MICHI (ミチ) is a Japanese singer under record label Pony Canyon. Biography Produced by Elements Garden, Michi began her career with her debut single, “Cry for the Truth/Secret Sky”, which served as the opening and ending theme songs to the anime television series Rokka: Braves of the Six Flowers. She has released two other singles of which her song "Checkmate!?" peaked at #51. This song was used as the opening song to Dagashi Kashi. Her third single, "Realistic!", was used as the first ending theme to the anime Kuromukuro. She released her first album called "Sprint for the Dreams" on September 21, 2016. Michi was a guest at the 2016 Anime Expo, and was a guest at Otakon 2016. Her song "I4U" was used as the ending theme to the 2017 anime television series Tsugumomo. Her song "Soranetarium" (ソラネタリウム) was used as the opening theme to the 2018 anime television series The Girl in Twilight. (Source: en.wikipedia.org)

Originating from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

_Note: Not to be confused with either the [Duel Masters character designer](https://anilist.co/staff/185645/) or the [studio coordinator](https://anilist.co/staff/172956/)._
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tmypg12)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/関口可奈味)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/), currently affilaited with [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).
